data_description.enable_ha_control: Enable Home Assistant device control through the conversation agent. Allows the agent to turn devices on/off, query states, and control your smart home.
data_description.enable_memory: Enable semantic memory with Mem0 for personalized, context-aware conversations that persist across sessions.
data_description.memory_storage_path: Custom path for storing memory data (leave empty for default: /config/.storage/bedrock_agent_memory). Path must be writable.

data_description.title: The title of your Agend in Home Assistant.

data_description.region: The AWS region where Bedrock services will be accessed (e.g., us-east-1, eu-west-1). Different regions have different models available.
data_description.key_id: Your AWS access key ID for authentication.
data_description.key_secret: Your AWS secret access key for authentication. This will be stored securely.

aws_config.description: Update AWS credentials and region. After saving, you'll need to verify/update the AI model for the new region.
aws_config.title: AWS Configuration

data_description.model_id: Select the AI model to use for conversations. Foundation models and inference profiles are available based on your AWS region. Verify this model is available in your region.
data_description.prompt_context: System prompt that defines the agent's behavior and personality. This is sent with every conversation.

ai_config.description: Configure the AI model and system prompt. The model list has been updated based on your AWS region. The integration will reload after saving.
ai_config.title: AI Configuration

data_description.enable_memory: Enable semantic memory with Mem0 for personalized, context-aware conversations that persist across sessions.
data_description.memory_storage_path: Custom path for storing memory data (leave empty for default: /config/.storage/bedrock_agent_memory). Path must be writable.
data_description.memory_guidelines: Custom instructions for the agent about what to store in memory and what to ignore. This helps control memory storage behavior and supports different languages.

memory_config.description: Configure memory settings. The integration will reload after saving.
memory_config.title: Memory Configuration

data_description.enable_ha_control: Enable Home Assistant device control through the conversation agent. Allows the agent to turn devices on/off, query states, and control your smart home.

tools_config.description: Configure which tools the agent can use. The integration will reload after saving.
tools_config.title: Tools Configuration

cognitive_task.description: This service provides a convenient and efficient way to send multimodal prompts to Antropic Claude models through the Amazon Bedrock platform. It supports both generic text-based prompts as well as prompts that include multiple images, allowing for a more comprehensive and engaging interaction with the AI models.

model_id.description: Unique identifier assigned to a specific LLM. Default: anthropic.claude-3-haiku-20240307-v1:0
model_id.name: Model ID

prompt.description: Textual input that the model uses to generate or continue output.
prompt.example: Describe what you see in these images
prompt.name: Prompt
